originalText.text:
My session with Sophia was very informative and I thought well-worth the price I paid.
I have already thrown out the foundation I was using (it had cool undertones ðŸ˜‚ and I am a warm/soft autumn). And thankfully the rest of my makeup was mostly the correct colors to flatter me but now I feel like I REALLY know how to use them. I have been having fun experimenting and using different shades together. Now that I have a clearer idea of what looks good together based on my palette, I cannot wait to go shopping for some basics and separates to mix and match.

originalText.text: I'm planning to buy a new wardrobe this year so I decided to get a color analysis. A lot of colors I never thought to try actually look great on me. I've already bought a sweater in one of the colors and I was really surprised how much of a difference it makes. Mariana was sweet and lovely to work with. I've always wanted to do a color analysis and I'm so glad I finally did!

I've always wanted to do a color analysis and I'm so glad I finally did!

originalText.text: I loved this experience! I had finally decided to get my color analysis done after struggling to understand how to dress my best for years. Mariana was so sweet and professional, and the appointment felt like a collaboration with someone who wanted me to truly understand the process for myself. It was a very safe and refreshing experience altogether, I highly recommend this to anyone who is still on the fence!

originalText.text: Color analysis with Mariana has been the best investment Iâ€™ve made. She was super sweet and so informative about what colors look best on me. Having my palette has made shopping for clothing and accessories so much easier. Highly recommend!!

text.text: Color analysis with Mariana has been the best investment Iâ€™ve made. She was super sweet and so informative about what colors look best on me. Having my palette has made shopping for clothing and accessories so much easier. Highly recommend!!

originalText.text:
I realized after my session that the seasonal analysis system does not work on everyone.  The person who did mine, I believe, realized that as well during our session.

She seemed kind of new to it â€“ if that is the case, I should have been charged less for less experience.  I am not writing this to be mean, but want to be honest.  She draped warmer colors on me and said they made my skin look green.  She then asked me if I had olive skin â€“ that when I knew she was not experienced.

Many people have commented on my olive skin before.  I told her yes, I do have olive skin.  She asked me where I was from and I told her I am Caribbean and she told me that those people do not have olive skin typically.  This is not true â€“ we are tri-racial and most people I know who are Caribbean have olive skin.  Then she tried cooler colors on me, she paused and said the cool colors are better, but bring out my dark under eyes.  This is where I realized the seasonal color system is not accurate.

I am pretty neutral, but more cool leaning.  Some cool colors look great on me, but I noticed if they are TOO cool, they can look off.  Some less harsh warmer colors look good on me too.  But again, if they are TOO warm, it will look off.  I have a background in painting nudes â€“ I have been making my own paint colors for 20 years, so I have a deep understanding of color mixing (especially skin tones).

It was fun to try, but I just donâ€™t 100% buy this method of figuring out your colors.  I heard in Japan they do not use the seasonal palettes; they actually go through every color and pick your colors individually.  I think that may be a better process for more neutral skin-tones.
